ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Recognizing other people's emotions, particularly negative emotions, based on facial expression, body language, and/or vocal tone and rate?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Very Mild; 3 = Mild; 4 = Moderate; 5 = Moderately Severe; 6 = Severe; 7 = Extremely Severe

ElementDescription: Interpreting social interactions in a malevolent, hostile manner?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Very Mild; 3 = Mild; 4 = Moderate; 5 = Moderately Severe; 6 = Severe; 7 = Extremely Severe

ElementDescription: Makind decisions quickly without examining other evidence?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Very Mild; 3 = Mild; 4 = Moderate; 5 = Moderately Severe; 6 = Severe; 7 = Extremely Severe

ElementDescription: Being flexible in interpreting social situations?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Very Mild; 3 = Mild; 4 = Moderate; 5 = Moderately Severe; 6 = Severe; 7 = Extremely Severe

ElementDescription: Can change or correct their interpretation of social interactions when wrong?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Very Mild; 3 = Mild; 4 = Moderate; 5 = Moderately Severe; 6 = Severe; 7 = Extremely Severe

ElementDescription: Understanding subtle jokes, sarcasm, and insults in conversation?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Very Mild; 3 = Mild; 4 = Moderate; 5 = Moderately Severe; 6 = Severe; 7 = Extremely Severe

ElementDescription: Seeing things from the perspective of other?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Very Mild; 3 = Mild; 4 = Moderate; 5 = Moderately Severe; 6 = Severe; 7 = Extremely Severe

ElementDescription: Understanding subtle social cues, hints, and indeirect requests?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Very Mild; 3 = Mild; 4 = Moderate; 5 = Moderately Severe; 6 = Severe; 7 = Extremely Severe

ElementDescription: How frequently did the respondent have contact with the subject?
Notes: 1 = Less than 1 hour per week; 2 = 1-2 hours per week; 3 = 2-3 hours per week; 4 = 3-4 hours per week; 5 = 4-5 hours per week; 6 = 5-6 hours per week; 7 = 6-7 hours per week; 8 = More than 7 hours per week
